metadata.title: CVE-2021-23999 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If a Blob URL was loaded through some unusual user interaction, it couldhave been loaded by the System Principal and granted additional privilegesthat should not be granted to web content. This vulnerability affectsFirefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird < 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
